Class MlflowClient

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.server.integrations.MlflowClient
public class MlflowClient extends Object
Production-ready MLflow Tracking Server client. Integrates with MLflow REST API to log experiments, runs, parameters, and metrics for distributed scientific computing jobs.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)
See Also:
  • MLflow REST API

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MlflowClient()
    Creates a new MLflow client using configuration from ApplicationConfig.

  • Constructor Details

    • MlflowClient

      public MlflowClient()
      Creates a new MLflow client using configuration from ApplicationConfig.

  • Method Details

    • logArtifact

      public void logArtifact(String runId, Path file, String artifactPath)
      Logs a file artifact to the MLflow run. Uses the MLflow 2.0 artifact proxy API.
      Parameters:
      runId - Run ID
      file - Path to the file to upload
      artifactPath - Destination path within the artifact repository (optional)

    • getExperimentId

      public String getExperimentId()
      Get the experiment ID for this client.
      Returns:
      MLflow experiment ID

    • startRun

      public CompletableFuture<String> startRun(String runName)
      Starts a new run within the experiment.
      Parameters:
      runName - Descriptive name for the run
      Returns:
      CompletableFuture with run ID

    • logParam

      public void logParam(String runId, String key, String value)
      Logs a parameter for a run.
      Parameters:
      runId - Run ID
      key - Parameter name
      value - Parameter value

    • logMetric

      public void logMetric(String runId, String key, double value, long timestamp)
      Logs a metric for a run.
      Parameters:
      runId - Run ID
      key - Metric name
      value - Metric value
      timestamp - Timestamp in milliseconds

    • endRun

      public void endRun(String runId, String status)
      Ends a run with a status.
      Parameters:
      runId - Run ID
      status - Run status (FINISHED, FAILED, KILLED)

    • isServerReachable

      public boolean isServerReachable()
      Checks if the MLflow server is reachable.
      Returns:
      true if server responds
